stem_html: A light bulb has a luminous flux of 942 lumens. What is the illuminance on a surface 3.00\,\text{m} from the bulb when it is lit?

answers.content_html: The reflected light is polarized in the vertical direction.

answers.content_html: The reflected light is polarized in the horizontal direction.
answers.feedback_html: The light is very glaring due to polarization in the horizontal direction.

answers.content_html: The reflected light has less intensity than the incident light.
answers.feedback_html: The glare from the snow is not the result of a change in the intensity of the light.

answers.content_html: The reflected light has triple the intensity of the incident light.
answers.feedback_html: The reflected light intensity must be less than the incident intensity, because of energy conservation.

stem_html: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) recommends an illuminance of 500\,\text{lx} for desktop lighting. An office space has lighting hung 2.50\,\text{m} above desktop level that provides only 300\,\text{lx}. To what height would the lighting fixtures have to be lowered to provide 500\,\text{lx} on desktops?
